minimization_history module

Module with wrappers for target functions to save the results obtained throughout the entire minimization process.

class minimization_history.MinimizationHistory(dim: int)

Bases: object

__init__(dim: int)
append_evaluation(number_of_evaluations: int, f_min: float, x_best: ndarray)

Append the input values to the history.

Parameters:

  • number_of_evaluations (int) – the current number of evaluations

  • f_min (float) – the current minimum value of the target function

  • x_best (array_like) – the arguments for the current minimum, should be of length dim (see __init__)

property dim: int
property elapsed_time: float
property evaluations
property f_mins
classmethod load_results(path: Path) → MinimizationHistory

Factory method to create an object from saved files.

Parameters:

path (Path) – the path to the directory containing the files saved by the save_results method.

Returns:

the loaded results

Return type:

(MinimizationHistory)

save_results(path: Path)

Save the results to file.

Parameters:

path (Path) – the directory in which the results should be saved.

start_timing()

class minimization_history.TargetWrapper(target_function: Callable, dim: int)

Bases: object

Class with __call__ method to be called by optimizer. State variables like number of function calls, best values obtained etc. are instance variables.

__call__(x)

Evaluate the target function, and save the results.

Parameters:

x (array_like) – argument to be passed on to the target function, should be of length dim (see __init__)

Returns:

the result from evaluating the target function

__init__(target_function: Callable, dim: int)
Parameters:

  • target_function (Callable) – the function to minimize, should take one array_like input argument x of length dim elements

  • dim (int) – the number of elements in x, the input argument to the function to be minimized

append_best_evaluation()

Append the current values of the properties to the history.
